page.title: 08K'minster Carpets - History.
page.content: {1735-1985: 250 years of carpet manu- {facturing.}The first carpet loom was erected in the town in 1735 and by 1800 Kidderminster had the largest concentration of carpet manufacture in the world. From a simple home industry the carpet trade expanded with the Industrial Revolution: factories were built, power looms were introduced. During the present century electricity has taken the place of steam power, and since 1945 the most important innovations have been the introduction of tufted carpets and the widespread use of man-made fibres. The intro- duction of modern processes has given rise to competition at home and abroad in recent years, but by concentrating on high-quality traditional carpets, Kidderminster remains the{world centre for{woven}carpets. {
